meanings.definition: In a direction at right angles to the length of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The seagull flew abeam, crossing the ship's path.
meanings.sent2: The airplane passed abeam the lighthouse on its way to the airport.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull decided to fly abeam the ship, surprising the sailors.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed abeam, reaching every corner of the deck.
meanings.sent5: The bright red flag fluttered abeam, catching the captain's attention.

meanings.definition: In a position to the side of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The rescue boat approached abeam, ready to assist the stranded ship.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter hovered abeam the yacht, ready to lower the supplies.
meanings.sent3: The curious dolphin swam abeam the cruise ship, playfully racing alongside.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight shone abeam, casting a gentle glow on the water.
meanings.sent5: The seagulls perched abeam, watching the sailors with interest.
